{"text": "Well that was interesting, a nice little lovecraftian game that didn't stink.  Fairly immersive to a point, and a couple of interesting twists.  Definitely in the adventure category as it mostly consists of finding and using items, definitely an item hunt.  I do have to say there were a very few points where what you were supposed to do or where to go next was a little obscure, and a couple of the item orders will have you scratching your head at the lack of realistic logical setup. Without giving anything away I'll just say that it seems like an awful lot of trouble for cultists to go to every time they want to open their secret entrance It has pretty good atmosphere, and it made me jump a few times.  After a while though you get used to the rules of the chase and it looses a ltittle of it's tension.  The first person is very smooth, although crossing narrow boards, or jumping gaps is a bit clunky at times (not that it really matters as checkpoints are plentiful).  The graphics are superb as one would expect from someone using cryengine. The music is suitably atmsophereic, although what really made me most tense were the occassional periods of absolute silence. On sound I have to say it went a tiny bit extra.   In the woods, you hear twigs cracking  that you didn't step on letting you know that you aren't alone out there.  Animals sometimes go silent around threat. Large bushes swish when you go through them.   Nice little touches.  I didn't notice any glaring graphical or technical issues, and overall it was fun.  A tad short, taking me 5,7 hours, so expect 4-6 depending on how much sightseeing you do.   If I had any real complaint about it, it would be the font size of the readables.  Anyone with bad eyes not sitting within 6-8 inches of the monitor will be lucky to be able to read any of it. Overall, I quite enjoyed it. {"text": "НОРМ ИГРА", "appid": "343440", "steamid": "profiles/76561198170829302", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "1", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1460116800.0}
{"text": "If you can get past some clunky controls and mechanics that take some time to get used to, then you might enjoy a pretty good and challenging Survival Horror game, with a robust story told through the perspective of three different characters (each with their own goals and motivations) struggling to survive the consequences of a viral outbreak that devastated the city of Keen Sight. Daymare: 1998 looks like a regular TPS with zombies on the surface, but it's actually a very slow-paced game where item management takes a very important role (more important than fighting). If you don't have the patience to deal with a lot of inventory navigation, somewhat unfriendly controls, or \"controversial\" reloading mechanics, then this game might be not for you. In this game, you don't just \"press R to reload your weapon\", you need to take your time to manage your inventory, combine bullets, get magazines ready, craft healing items, free up slots, etc. while you're in a safe zone, because if you expect to manage your supplies in the middle of a fight, well, game over screen might find you rather quick. Preparation in Daymare is key to survive. Pros: +Slow-paced gameplay with plenty of inventory management akin to classic Survival Horror games. +Satisfying story mode length, with multiple and pretty well designed locations to visit through its five chapters, and very deep lore. +'Daymare' difficulty that provides a nice and intense challenge, where you can easily run out of bullets if you're not careful enough. Cons: -Lack of enemy variety. Except for a few different enemies and bosses, you only fight regular zombies the entire game. -No key remapping option (Fixed for the most part, check edit at the end for details) All in all, recommended. It has its flaws and rough edges, but considering it was made from an indie developer with a team of around ten people (and it's their first game) they did a great job. Definitely better than I expected. Thanks to jkennedy1204 for gifting me a copy. Edit 11-26: Quickly updating this review because a new free bonus game, called HADES Dead End, has been added a few days ago (it has currently two maps to play in, and there's two more to be added later). Key mapping feature has also been added some time ago, however it only applies to character controls. Inventory controls still cannot be changed.", "appid": "842100", "steamid": "profiles/76561198013623613", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "9", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1569240000.0}

{"text": "Lego Marvel Super Heroes is a Lego-themed action-adventure video game developed by Traveller's Tales and published by Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment for the PlayStation 3, Xbox 360, Wii U, PlayStation 4, Xbox One and Microsoft Windows, and published by Feral Interactive for OS X. The game features gameplay similar to other Lego titles, such as Lego Star Wars: The Complete Saga and Lego Batman 2: DC Super Heroes, alternating between various action-adventure sequences and puzzle-solving scenarios. The handheld version of the game by TT Fusion was released under the title Lego Marvel Super Heroes: Universe in Peril for iOS, Android, Nintendo DS, Nintendo 3DS and PlayStation Vita. Characters include Iron Man, Captain America, Hulk, Spider-Man, Black Widow, Hawkeye, Thor, the X-Men, the Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer and Nick Fury. A spin-off to the Lego Marvel series titled Lego Marvel's Avengers was released on 26 January 2016. A sequel, Lego Marvel Super Heroes 2, was announced to be in development on 15 May 2017, is set to release for Microsoft Windows, Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One on 14 November 2017. It starts with the characters. Where LEGO Batman 2 offers a sizable roster of heroes and villains, the campaign in LEGO Marvel delivers more playable heroes in a much more coherent story about collecting cosmic bricks around the world before villains do. The first mission starts with Iron Man and Hulk, but the selection of playable characters soon grows to include the rest of the Avengers, the Fantastic Four, loads of X-Men, and even Spider-Man. You'll even switch heroes mid-way through many of the missions, with Cyclops and Jean Grey rescuing Storm and Iceman during an assault on the X-Mansion, or the Human Torch flying in to assist Black Widow and Hawkeye as they infiltrate a Hydra base. The entrances and exits are all handled as part of the story, which gives you a chance to play several characters who all feel like they're part of a single narrative. I finished the main campaign in under 12 hours, but I've been coming back to collect extra characters and bricks for days after. In between missions, there's a massive open-world map of Manhattan to explore, from the Statue of Liberty and Battery Park to the X-Mansion up past Harlem. There's also the massive SHIELD Helicarrier floating over the East River. The city has loads of attractions, complete with characters to collect and challenges to beat. Over the course of the side missions, you'll help Heimdall take out frost giants on the docks, battle Sentinels in the streets, or take control of a neglectful boyfriend's mind and make him climb the Empire State Building to apologize to his girlfriend. Overall, I would give this game a 9/10. {"text": "Dark Souls 2 не таит в себе каких-то тайн в плане своего концепта, она лишь увеличивает элементы оригинала. Мир Dark Souls 2 в разы больше, чем мир оригинала. Окрестности Дранглика можно исследовать на протяжении добрых сорока часов, без учета времени, которое вы оставите на боссах. Повествователями в игре служат механики и визуал, туманные NPS которые любят недосказанность в словах, и реплики, пластично подающиеся интерпретациям игрока, беседы с ними ли ж озадачивают, пока в современных трипл-ААА проектах персонажи прямолинейно рассказывают о игровом мире, в Dark Souls 2 каждый монолог с NPS оставляет еще больше вопросов. Классический вид повествования для Хидэтаки Миядзаки, когда картину происходящего каждый игрок объясняет по-своему, за счет своего личного понимания вещей. Описание предметов еще больше погружает в мир Dark Souls 2, а так же дает понимание того что каждая вещь в игре алебарда, душа преследователя и тд.. филигранно вплетены в мироздание Dark Souls 2.Геймплей как и нарратив не объяснит, куда идти? что делать? и как делать? У вас будет всего одна глобальная цель, найти замок Дранглика и короля Вендрика, казалось бы простая задача перерастает в эпохальное приключение, достигнуть цели которого смогут только самые несгибаемые и стойкие. За ошибки мы теперь платим не только потерей всех собранных нами душ, но и утратой небольшой части нашего общего здоровья, да Dark Souls 2 наказывает еще строже за наши ошибки, что только умножает ее бескомпромиссную сложность. Единственный вариант вернуть себе всю полоску здоровья это использовать человеческую фигурку, которые встречаются как редкий ресурс. Смерть тоже часть мира игры, она словно фрагмент, без которого Dark Souls не Dark Souls. Темно красная надпись \"вы погибли\" преследует до конца как наставник, который намекает на просчет игрока и в следствие ошибку. В большинстве случаев ошибки в которых виноваты мы сами, а иногда сама игра, с её кривыми хитбоксами, которые вводят в ступор и отчаяние, игра которая прямо пропорционально основывается на твоих навыках, вдруг закидывает тебя своими проблемами и опыт перестает играть роль, тут же в подмогу кривым хитбоксам приходит кривая камера которая осела на серии соулс как пчела на опыляемом цветке. Но если пчела необходима цветку то зачем серия Dark Souls тянет на себе кривую камеру не ясно. Dark Souls 2 неоднозначна, и тут дело не только в некоторых огрехах игрового процесса, но и в стиле игры. Игра порадует разнообразием локаций, которых взаправду великое множество в игре, но переходы между локациями сделаны уж слишком странно, бут-то ты преодолеваешь брешь, между двумя абсолютно разными комнатами, только в одной холодные стены и тьма, а в другой адски жаркая цитадель, и не верится что их разделяет такая немощная преграда. Переходы между локациями сделаны резко, это очень тяжело воспринимать когда земляной пик с его каменными стенами находится по соседству с железной цитаделью где под тобой находится лава, и тут и там видны языки пламени. В контексте Dark Souls 2 такой минус становится колоссальным, потому что целостность мира испаряется, да локации по истине красивы и разнообразны, но разделения между ними вызывают фрустрацию. Из Маджулы(локации хаба) мы можем пойти куда захотим и в туманный лес, и собор лазурного пути, локации по истине роскошные и открывают такие виды, от которых хочется затаить дыхание и немного передохнуть, ведь впереди еще множество испытаний.Когда в первый раз видишь Маджулу перед тобой открывается обворожительный вид,как небесное светило отражается на водной глади что намекая на то что Маджула единственное светлое место этом темном королевстве и его землях. lvl-дизайн остался все таким же ,запутанным, пяти этажные локации заготовили для самых любопытных не только достойные награды но и ловушки, которые работают отлично, заставляя осматривать всю локации тщательно, проверяя ее на наличие заковыристых ловушек, и дают понять что вся локации это отдельное испытание, небольшая область, в которой всё и вся пытается тебя убить и показать тебе что тебе никто не рад в этом мире. Взаимодействие с миром дает тебе понять, что игра беспощадно будет проверять игрока на прочность, и его самообладание, на его контроль над собой.В локациях все так же легко потеряться ведь развилок очень много,пробегая одну и ту же локацию по нескольку раз можно наткнуться на недоступную ранее дверь или комнату,или пропущенный из-за невнимательности сундук. Дизайн боссов неоднозначный, иногда боссы по истине поражают своими размерами, и своим видом, от огромных скорпионов и пауков, до исполинских гигантов,но есть и не взрачные, но в основном боссы исполнены отлично. Когда первый раз встречаешь Гниющего, то задашься вопросом, что это вообще и как с этим биться?! А что может реально расстроить это скудный саундтрек, в первой части была умиротворяющая музыка, во второй как то совсем глухо, а когда дерёшься с боссом то никакого представления нет, из-за откровенно слабых композиций на боссах, ты не чувствуешь величие этой битвы, нету осознания что перед тобой значимый противник. Саундтрек Dark Souls 2 один из камней преткновения, концепция Dark Souls состоит не только в сложности, дизайне но и звуковом сопровождение, как при путешествие по окрестностям королевства так и при битве с боссом. Dark Souls 2 слегка утеряла эту связь, и поэтому ощущается иначе чем другие игры Миядзаки. Саундтрек Dark Souls 2 нельзя назвать откровенно слабым,просто он проседает на фоне остальным аспектов. Dark Souls 2 это новое виденье серии под другим углом,вторая часть не смотря на сходства, несколько отдалилась от своих собратьев,Dark Souls 2 без условно хорошая игра,но и весомые минусы у неё есть,это и скудный саундтрек это и переходы между локациями. Но не смотря на это Dark Souls 2 смогла сохранить большинство сильных черт игры. Игра все так же бросает вызов,и все так же оперирует старым геймдизайном. Что делает игру достоверно уникальной. Игру стоит брать только если вы готовы к трудностям,и достижению высшего наслаждения через мучения и мудреные трудности.", "appid": "236430", "steamid": "profiles/76561198325858742", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "36", "votes_funny": "1", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1587124800.0}

{"text": "游戏有点像是暗黑地牢和地下城守护者的结合出的2D 回合制Roguelike游戏，玩家扮演是地下城的领主，通过招募怪物、布置陷阱、释放法术来阻止地表英雄入侵。 基本流程： 游戏按周计算回合，每周有不同的选项，可以看做Roguelike游戏的选择节点，除了少数几个强制性固定事件外，其余周可以自己自由选择事件比如商店购物，比如去地表掠夺，如果选择战斗的话，也可以选择来袭的敌人是新人等级还是老手等级还是冠军等级。 当进入战斗后，分战前准备和战斗战术操作两块。站前，主要是在顺序随机的几个房间布置房间陷阱、安放怪物和法术。安排好之后，进入战斗战术阶段，等地表英雄入侵后，在回合制的游戏中，可以选择怪物不同技能来击杀或者吓退敌人。（击杀的话有物理伤害和元素伤害技，吓退的话主要是士气技） 游戏的养成元素： 一个存档中，领主的宝物、怪物等级、陷阱也可以升级和继承。 多周目中，领主的专长点可以累计。 游玩感觉： 第一次通关前，初次接触这种反英雄的地牢模式，研究配置和体会随机事件很好玩。但是击杀和吓退的难度设置不平衡，感觉像是经营鬼屋。 多周目后，没有难度选项，随机事件和英雄配置比较少，加上通关后五十几周就不能玩了，加上免费版地下城领主只能体验一个，后续多周目的游戏元素不够玩。 总的来说免费版本的框架挺好玩，期待完整版的游戏体验了。", "appid": "1151080", "steamid": "profiles/76561198067123260", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 0, "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1572523200.0}

{"text": "eXceed - Gun Bullet Children. Is a bullet hell shooter by Flat Software and Nyu Media. This shooter features a trio of girls who belong to the Church. They are Chinatsu Kagaya, Sowel Devosiana and Miyabi Housen. Chinatsu, Sowel and Miyabi are employed by the Church as the Gun Bullet Children to fight off the vampires that terrorize Tokyo. Over 5 levels, the three Gun Bullet Children will fight through hordes of enemies and of course there´s a boss in each level...Who would have thought that ;) It has great artwork in the character sprites, character special move names in Japanese flashing across the screen which resembles an action manga, game and soundtrack album covers, Steam badges, emoticons and profile backgrounds which make it attractive to showcase on profile.  The game also has fast catchy pop background music to keep players excited in the game as an arcade shooter, great voice acting and variable dialogue lines that are different depending on the character being chosen to play in the game. The game is also forgiving for casual players with an unlimited number of continues!! 7u7 Sadly, the dated graphics and game engine (as a game that is released back in 2005) has brought with it, a lot of problems with the Steam version of the game. First, the take screenshot feature in the Steam version doesn't work, neither is there any feature to pause the game or to play the game in windowed mode to take screenshots. Pressing the Esc button will immediately exit and close the game instead of pausing it. Secondly, when the game is downloaded and installed vanilla, all the dialogue in the story part of the game is very likely to be in garbled text unless the user's operating system is set at Japanese. A translation for the game to English is available from published Steam community guides, however it still has errors in the display on some punctuation symbols unless the user's operating system is set specifically to English for non-Unicode programs which poses a lot of inconvenience when setting up the game for the first time. Thirdly, there may also be significant frame rate drops in the form of lagging and stuttering especially during graphic intensive segments when a lot of bullets are being thrown about and a character is doing a special move. The game is also unresponsive if played on a gamepad controller. eXceed - Gun Bullet Children is a short arcade bullet hell shooter that offers a few hours of arcade shooter gameplay with attractive anime graphics, voice acting, background music, artwork and casual gameplay as an introduction to the eXceed series, with options to play at harder difficulty settings.  At the same time, it also suffers from display and technical problems as a game that is released more than 5 years ago, as well as limited variety in the level designs. For those who can overlook these faults with the game, I can recommend this game only when it is at a very attractive discounted price or bundle offer of a few dollars for the game and soundtrack DLC. {"text": "I'll admit that I never played any of the Resident Evil(s) over the years though I was a giant fan of the first movie that came out back in 2002 (Mila Jovovich FTW!). The first time I got my hands on an RE game was RE7: Biohazard and boy the scares in that game could result in spontaneous defecation to the faint of heart. RE2 is (apparently) a remake of an old classic but since I have no point of reference (and hence nostalgia) associated with this game I think I can give an uncoloured opinion of this game. Angry Joe is right - this is the game of the year (2019), there is so much care and design that has gone in this work of grotesque art and everything else about it has been carefully aligned to make a near perfect experience. You start off by playing as Leon Kennedy, a Racoon City police officer whose day on the job takes a horrifying turn when he begins investigating a seemingly abandon gas station. First thing you will notice is the par-excellent character and environmental design. The graphics are off the chain and clearly Capcom has pulled out all stops in ensuring that the rendition of a classic franchise is given the respect it deserves. This will of course greatly help in bringing both classic and new players into the RE lore. The sounds complement the visual aspects of RE2 perfectly, both in terms of music and SFX. As a matter of fact, the sense of perennial tension is instilled majorly by the sound design and music score of the game and MUST be applauded for what it achieves. The story itself is basically a 7/10 to be honest and some aspects of relationship dynamics between some prominent characters, I feel, needed to be much more fleshed out; but the story gives enough incentive, that along with the gameplay, this is an un-put-down-able experience. Navigating and backtracking is actually fun AF in RE2 and so many other franchises need to learn from this game on how to get that right. The game is also dotted with smartly designed puzzles that are challenging but never feel unfair, hence the sense of accomplishment is high when you do finally solve them on your own. Not since the original Dead Space have I felt this terror and for many a nights my ears will jump up at the sound of thumping footsteps and wonder, is Mr X coming to get me? Which reminds me to make a special mention on the model, sound and (zombie) AI - I always felt under constant threat (thanks Capcom). Inventory management too also doses you with further tension and adds to the survival element of RE2; so many times I have had to discard items after gruelling internal disputes over what items to keep and throw away. This game is worth the hard work you put in your money and should be lauded for it's design choices. I reckon even the veteran players of the RE franchise would be mighty happy with this beautifully crafted action/survival horror gem. Edit: I came back to give this game a full score a full year after completing it. 10/10", "appid": "883710", "steamid": "profiles/76561198061419773", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 0, "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1581163200.0}

{"text": "The game is a little hidden gem, especially if you like some shrouded mysteries with   theme. Despite it, while the game is funny and suitable to all ages, don't mistake it for your usual casual game! It actually have more in common with Super Meat Boy with some levels being ridiculously hard, especially later down the road. Sure, it is beatable, but if you crank the difficulty to hard or aim for some achievements, some levels will get you annoyed until you finally beat it ;). The game originally launched as a Linux-exclusive after being kickstarted, but is available multiplafrorm now. At the time of review only episode 1 is available with 2 in works. Despite a few odd bogs and inconsistency in gameplay mechanics (which were tweaked over time and probably will be further polished), the game runs fine and is perfectly completable at the current state (it left Early Access after all!) – comparing to the previous builds, you can definitely see the work being put onto it :). The developer is helpful too – since the playerbase is small and the game was made on basically a custom engine, it's likely that whatever the bug you encounted will get resolved and your suggestions will get through, so you can have a direct influence making the game better, which is something I personally really like :). Overall, while not ideal, I'd definitely recommend the game, especially for it's current price and even less on a sale! {"text": "Отличный игра которая поможет скоротать вечера xD", "appid": "242920", "steamid": "profiles/76561198062887309", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "1", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1514116800.0}
{"text": "I’m really not a huge fan of these reviews with below 50h game time. I personally don’t feel like you can fully judge a MMORPG in this time.                           So first of all, what surely most people who are interested in Black Desert Online are wondering about. Is it Pay to Win?  The answer would be a yes and no. You can p2w the enchanting but there is not much of a reason for it in my opinion. Also, it’s incredibly expensive to do so. In my nearly 3 1/2yrs of playing BDO it never had an effect on me, so if you aren’t aiming to play in the top <5% of the player base, this shouldn’t affect you at all.              Black Desert Online has one, if not the best action combat system currently on the market. (That is subjective of course) So if you are a fan of this fighting style in MMORPG’s you definitely came to the right place. You can either drag the skills to your Hotbar, or activate them with Key combinations, so its quite dynamic.       BDO’s gameplay is highly focused on grinding, so you definitely have to be a fan of that. They also worked on the quest system in the last year and improved it a lot, which makes it a viable progress path now days.             There are 19 classes, which are genderlocked. Some classes have a male/female version which plays a bit different, so you should be fine, even with the genderlock in place and not limited in what you want to play!    You can also create a test character which allows you to try out your chosen class on a higher level first, so see if you enjoy it or not!      Beside that Black Desert has probably the best character editor you can find at the moment. It feels as close to a tool the developers use themselves as you can get. You can easily spend hours with it. Or if you aren’t into that, you can just load a preset from the beauty gallery. A tool where players can upload their character creation for others to use.                   Black Desert Online's Gameworld is massive. From deep woods, Ruins, over savannas, Coastal Areas, Massive Mountainous Areas, a giant desert up to a huge Ocean filled with many many islands. And all reachable without any loading screens.    Since there are close to no options to teleport in BDO you really get a feeling for the vastness of this world, which is definitely a big plus in my book. But I can see that some people also might not enjoy it, that they cant just teleport half across the world.       The game has a vast amount of options of graphic sound etc, so it should pretty much run well on most machines. And it looks absolutely beautiful on the higher settings.  BDO also supports 4K and even 8K resolution.       Beside the grinding, Black Desert offers a massive professions system, called Lifeskilling in the game. There is a total of 11 Lifeskills, which you can all do, there is no limitation. Added to the lifeskill system, the game as a Node System. In basic, there are nodes all over the world, which can produce different goods, and you can/need to hire workers to gather these materials.             BDO also offers Guild vs Guild PvP. Node Wars (Guild vs Guild fighting about special nodes) And Large Scale PvP. Each area has a Castle for which ownership guilds can fight.              There is a good amount of World Bosses that spawn at set times.               What Black Desert doesn’t have are Dungeons or Raids. If you are looking for that, this is definitely not your game.                             It's very easy now days to get into the game. The main story line, gives you lots of good gear to progress though the game and sends you right across all corners of the game world. They really improved this aspect of the game massively over the past 1 ½ years.        But Black Desert also has some very complex systems that may need a while to get behind, but these aren’t mandatory mostly. What I personally enjoy about these is, that they aren’t complicated for the sake of being complicated but all make sense the way they are.  And there are enough wikipages and guides that will help you to understand it all, if you happen to become interested in this aspect of the game.              Unlike most MMORPG’s BDO has a steady gear progression. So new expansions don’t add a large number of new Items which make the old ones useless. They add stronger Items from time to time, but these mostly just add a little bit of extra power, so you won’t replace your whole gear every couple of months, once you get your hands on the higher tier items.    For gear Improvement the game has an enchanting system that is highly focused on rng, but can be influenced with various technics and items.  This is definitely one of the most complex aspects of the game.  And I wouldn’t recommend newer players to get right into it, since it can become really expensive.    If you don’t to enchant your gear, just farming silver and buying it is also a viable option, since every item can be sold via in in game marketplace.     Black Desert Online is definitely not your usual MMORPG in some aspect, and does some things different, like no dungeons or raids, and the gear progression system.  It's definitely not a game for everyone and by far not perfect. But I enjoy my time here quite a lot, and I would definitely recommend to give it a go.    And if only to play around with the amazing character editor and the fun action combat system.", "appid": "582660", "steamid": "profiles/76561197999498546", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "92", "votes_funny": "11", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1595851200.0}

{"text": "How is it humanly possible to make serenic views, tea parties, and undersea villages horrifying? American McGee found a way, and it is terrifying as it is beautiful. Even knowing how it would end (a friend spoiled it for me -_-) and without playing American McGee's Alice first, it was still fun and it kept suprising me. Pros: -Beautiful graphics -Amazing voice acting -The story (it's original and different compared to the other interpretations of Alice in Wonderland). -The soundtrack  -The dresses are beautiful and after completing the game the dresses get buffs or debuffs (to give you a harder challenge) -Puzzles weren't too difficult -The graphics -You experience Wonderland and Reality, which is interesting to add to the story -Interesting weapons and mechanics -Did I mention the graphics? {"text": "其实这个系列前面两作我都玩过，但是因为未知的原因都弃坑了，而且这个系列因为bug和一些其他的问题一直饱受争议，我本来以为这个系列不会有续作了，然而CI还是坚持不懈的出了， 毕竟车枪球这些题材永远会有玩家买账，至少为这种精神点个赞。    CE引擎塑造的这个开放世界画质称得上上乘，材质，光影效果都不错，但是惨不忍睹的人物建模和低劣的过场动画减分不少。游戏的地图很大，而且CI从他们波兰同行的身上学习到了将整个地图塞满了密密麻麻的“？”，一方面逼死了强迫症，另一方面给人一种咱的开放世界很有料的样子，然而开放世界的内容丰富与否并不取决于这些满地的搜集品，巫师3的优秀也不是因为那满地的问号。显然CI借鉴波兰同行的时候没有借鉴别人最优秀的地方，而是借鉴了最简单省事的。   因此在游戏的过程中基本上都是开车到下一个任务地点，其实游戏中的房屋基本上都能进入，哨塔和信号塔基本上都能爬上去，然后就没有然后了，基本上只是在这些房屋里搜刮一些交易品。     其实本作在细节方面还是有一些亮点的。开车时车内的仪表盘显示都很真实。不同的狙击枪击中敌人有不同的效果，比如说小口径狙击枪爆头只是在敌人的脑袋上开个洞，大口径狙击枪就直接能把敌人的狗头炸成烂西瓜。爆头时会有类似于狙击精英的慢镜头特写。游戏过程中的帧数基本上都是稳定的，但是在游戏最后一关进入炼油厂基地后游戏会突然掉帧，不得不说优化还是存在一些问题。     本作大概讲述了正义的美帝又跑到别人的领地上帮助反抗军对付另外一个势力的故事， 其实这类游戏来说剧情并不重要，剧情的作用只是给你一个爆敌人狗头的理由而已，你们关心的也只是爆敌人狗头本身而不是剧情（滑稽）。    其实我并不愿意把这两个游戏放在一起比较，根本就是两个完全不同类型的游戏，只是因为都带了个sniper这个词发售时间又相近，很多人就说玩这个不如去玩狙击精英之类的，所以在这儿多说两句。本作更像一个严重缩水版的开放世界RPG，而狙击精英4完全是一个战役闯关游戏，狙击精英有多人，这游戏多人多半鸽了。狙击精英在细节刻画上比本作强，bug少得多，子弹击中效果更为真实。本作枪械改装和成长要素更为丰富，狙击瞄准时更真实一些。两作共同的毛病，人物的脸都是崩的，敌人完全弱智，剧情基本上白开水。但是你要问我更喜欢哪个，我其实更偏爱本作一些，这个不是在说哪个更好，而是个人比较喜欢这种类型的。", "appid": "368070", "steamid": "profiles/76561198212230819", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "35", "votes_funny": "1", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1500033600.0}

{"text": "I got this game right when it was released. I have seen it change quite a bit. The addition of new enemies, weapons and gameplay. The current state of the game is very good. It is still in early access but runs very well and a majority of the bugs that plagued the game when it was first released have been fixed. Now onto the gameplay itself. Im sure if you dont own this game yet and are still looking into it you have watched at least a few videos of gameplay. Let me be the first to tell you that watching someone play it versus playing it yourself are VERY different. Now granted yes, that can be said with any game, however this game has a way of pulling you into it. The sounds are fantastic. Playing with headphones is not required but will give you the best effect, not to mention it will help with hearing enemy footsteps. The visuals in this game are amazing as well, it wont take long to have you immersed. The PVP in this game is also unlike most others ive played. It is extremely intense and is one of the only games that can get my heart racing the way it does. I feel as if i need to smoke a cigarette after some matches. When your in a gunfight with a team, and everyone is constantly changing cover, and at the same time there are various types of (zombies) all around and the ever present danger of another team joining into the fight, it can get you going. This game can be played many different ways, run and gun, hiding and waiting, and everything in between. However every way of playing has its pros and cons so finding the happy balance is key. I recommend this game 100%. But i also recommend buying 2 copies. One for your and one for a friend. This game is played best with a friend, however it is still alot of fun going solo or with a random partner. All in all theres much more too come with this game and it can only get better from here.", "appid": "594650", "steamid": "profiles/76561198004092896", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "4", "votes_funny": "1", "early_access": true, "tstamp_created": 1544961600.0}
{"text": "Par où commencer ? L'un des meilleurs jeu de 2017, mais surtout un jeu qui me restera en mémoire pendant longtemps. C'est un jeu qu'il faut faire, je ne sais pas comment le dire autrement. En tout cas si l'on a un coeur, car je sais que certains n'ont pas d'âme xD . Je n'en dirai pas plus au niveau de l'histoire, il faut vraiment la découvrir par soi-même et éviter les spoils. J'en ressort marqué, c'est tout ce que je peux dire ^^. Niveau gameplay c'est principalement un beat'em all 3d avec un semi monde ouvert, donc personnellement j'étais aux anges ^^.  Le seul comparatif que je pourrai faire serait du coup Darksiders, mais avec un système de combat plus proche de Bayonetta, même si moins profond. (normal vu que Platinum Game à participer au jeu certains diront ^^). Sinon, Il y a pas mal de phases qui varient le gameplay,  changement de caméra, phases shoot'em up, voir danmaku par moment ^^ . Et cela donne à chaque fois une fraicheur et fait que l'on ne s'ennuie jamais vraiment, évitant la redondance. Certains pourront reprocher du backtracking mais ça ne m'a pas dérangé, au contraire ça m'a permis de vraiment me familiariser avec chaque zones. Fouiller bien d'ailleurs celles-ci, il y a plein de secrets. Je conseil aussi de ne pas rusher le jeu, de le faire à son rythme, en faisant toutes les quêtes secondaires.  Si vous trouvez le jeu trop simple, n'hésitez pas à monter la difficulté, c'est ce que j'ai fais au bout d'un moment personnellement.  Les musiques sont vraiment superbes, elles peuvent presque justifier à elle seule de se faire le jeu. Que du bon, du très bon à ce niveau là (découvrez les en jouant au jeu, pas en allant sur youtube les écouter, elles n'en seront que plus grandiose) Tout ce que je pourrai lui reprocher c'est que certaines capacités (2 en l'occurence) m'ont paru un peu trop forte par rapport aux autres. Donc un petit problème d'équilibrage je dirai. Personnellement je les ai du coup laisser de côtés pour me donner un peu plus de défi . Mais c'est à vous de voir ;) . Je conseille donc fortement ce jeu, surtout si il y a une offre de réduction dessus, ça vaut très clairement le coup. Il y a peu de jeu qui me donne envie de les faire à 100%, et pourtant celui-là j'en ai envie, et je n'ai toujours pas fini au bout de 100h de jeu, donc niveau contenu, c'est un vrai jeu vidéo complet qui n'aura pas du contenu manquant à cause de paywall ou de dlc (même si il y a un dlc, c'est un vrai rajout, ce n'est pas manquant au jeu de base comme malheureusement beaucoup d'autres jeux) et donc vu que c'est de moins en moins la norme je trouve qu'il faut le préciser et applaudir le jeu pour ça aussi. {"text": "I love everything but the graphics.  The gameplay remains tight and very fun and with the various settings you can create the perfect gamemode for you, even re-create the basic sword vs sword of Nidhogg 1 if you don't want all the new weapons. The graphics are my only real complaint. Instead of the one-step-above-Atari level simplicity of the original game they crank it all the way to 'modern pixel art indie game'. Despite being way more detailed and its clear work went into it I would have been much happier with something closer to the original. Maybe it was a marketing move or something but the blocky simplistic look of the original will always be more memorable and oddly more beautiful than the somewhat cluttered look of the sequel. From a gameplay perspective it also is a bit odd as before the very clearly defined objects and characters made spacing between combatants very clear after a couple games. The newer style has a tendency to obscure or confuse the player thanks to all the unnecessary detail. This wont bother everyone but its definitely something worth pointing out. Even so the game is pretty good and the variety of gameplay helps make up for the change in art style. I tend to keep both Nidhogg 1 and 2 installed depending on the mood my group is in. I would recommend it even if like me, the style puts you off.", "appid": "535520", "steamid": "profiles/76561198041006664", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "24", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1562155200.0}

{"text": "I have never been a big fan of Space Shooters, but Asteroid Bounty Hunter really helped me to find some comfort and liking in this genre. What ABH does especially well is create some tense battle moments that make you almost fall off your chair as you make it in the slip of the moment (or not). I can definitly recommend it for that, if you can put the awful story aside. Don't get me wrong, I have not seen many space shooters that actually give a damn aside from smashing the gunbuttons, so the effort is appreciated and should serve as an example for other space shooters. It cannot be helped, however, that the story is non-existant, with mediocre quality voice-acting and merely serves as small intermezzo's to keep a certain line of interest among the levels (which succeeded in that very small aspect). In short: + Excellent combat + Excellent powers, they all have their devastating effect and none of them are too OP or worthless + Moderatly good upgrade system, allowing you to choose early-on what's most important for your ship + Very original bossfights + Multiple ships to choose from + Decent graphics and great-looking effects + Repetitive, although replayable levels that after finishing them offers replayabilty on a number of different difficulties + You can play your OWN music through the game (highly recommended look below) - Terrible voice acting - Story could have more substance rather than: \"Oh I see this next boss, let's kill him\" 5 times over. - The music is mindblowing in almost the literal sense... Completely out of place in a spacegenre BUT it's driving nontheless. Still, more a negative than a positive. Default songs suck ass and you're better off playing your own through the game, which is possible (see above) The price is solid for the amount of gameplay and the quality of the difficulty progression. {"text": "EDIT : UPDATED - Ok so I've played this game now in fits and starts... so After my original review where i didnt reccomend this to anyone, and was upset with various aspects of the game.. Many months have passed and more dlc/updates and tweaks have been made.. now if this is how the game had launched I would have been wayyy more satisfied with this game... however it was a year late.. anyways that being said i'm gonna focus on the changes i've noticed / appreciated about this game. Previously you when hitting lvl 30 stopped gaining xp, and there was no benefit to doing anymore stuff in the main areas ( non Dark zone DZ ) Now you get a reward cache when getting 400k xp or somthing in that ballpark.. depending on your gear score you get drops and phoenix credits ( the premium currency in game ) So making sure you have all the intel, all the drops, missions and side jobs done you can earn xp towards somthing, they've upped the drop rates on randoms, and given set specfic rewards and other drops to certain missions which are worth grinding, well atleast its more fun cause even if you don't get the drop you want there are still a couple other ways you can improve your character .. to a point ( but that comes later )  The Underground -  Lots of fun at first, plenty of 'new' things to explore and blow up. after a bit it gets kinda repetitive. lvl 35 or so in underground rank atm, so can put directives down to increase the difficulty, chose between 1-3 phase and 3 difficulties on top of that, this can be done solo or with a group, it goes without saying its more fun to do with a group, also that and when you're alone if you die its over, atleast with teammates you can get healed and continue, but if all die you wipe and gain nothing..successful runs give you xp, underground xp, and gear... its fun, but after a while you kidna recognize all the pieces they 'randomize' the world with. its sewers so what do you really expect, but it makes grinding fun... if you don't know already grinding is what this game is about! -Survivor-  The other new mode where you start out with nothing and have to make a few items, keep fed and warm, use meds and fight, while competing with 20 or so other players in pvp or pve.. to make it to the dark zone, find something, and extract.. sounds easy, and for the most part it is.. if you are patient and take your time to loot everything, upgrade eq, mod it and slowly make your way to the DZ you can get there and complete. the first 3 times i tried it i got to extract 1, killed at extraction 1, and maintaince dc'd me the other.. the survival aspect is explained theres  movie and about as much plot as you should come to expect from this title... ITs fun, different ( sorta ) and no matter how you do ( although i've never outright died at the beginning ) you get loot drops for your main game character.. so its worth doing, and a good diversion if you're tired of tunnels or farming intel / grinding for .02 or god rolls on gear.a nice distraction indeed... PVP is still a bit wonky, and I find unless i am roaming the DZ with 3 other ppl on headsets the DZ is a nightmare.. people one shot you and come from nowhere steal your crap and then kill you again when you go for revenge, sometimes even if you run. that parts annoying,, but then again when you and your team gets picked on and they realize its 4 on 2 instead of 2 on 1 , you clean the house, get all thier loot and extract those moments make it all worth it.  They've added world teir levels to make the game harder on all modes, increase xp, drops and make it not such a breeze if you find things too easy... still once you get late game gear, find a weapon you like and build a set / fine tune it you shouldn't have much trouble doing whatever you want solo, or in a group.. but keep in mind if you wanna be competitive in the DZ you're gonna need to invest some serious time, min max your character to death, and keep going for god rolls, there are a couple builds that Are just plain better than others overall and in pvp its obvious when someone with a m700 sniper build oneshots you with all your buffs. then does the same to your whole team.. they have to be good with the rifle too.. but don't be surprised if someone comes along every now again and reminds you that there is much much better gear out there... So given all the updates and new content this game is finally worth buying. old review below ty for reading. Wow, where to start. when you spend over 100 on a game and get a release date, open/closed  betas ( that worked perfectly ) and then have these sorts of issues on launch day its kinda insane. But ok, forgive them for failing to notice that there might be an insane influx ( approx = to the presales/current sales of the game and its online only .... ) but not only divison players all uplay ( ugh what a crap program ) users were booted from their games... Theres my obligatory uplay bash before talking about teh game, because when uplay craps out ( which it often does ) you can't access a game you own... which is rediculous.... The game: Looks great, and plays great ( when it isnt glitching out )  preorder/gold edition rewards were too late to be useful, uplay rewards failed to load aswell. I'm a pretty lucky divison player reading thru the forums, there are a lot of errors and bugs that shouldn't exist in a finished product, not sure how many hours i've put in but of a max of 30 levels i'm at 25 and its 4 days or so after launch... i've been through most of hte content already and not even a week has passed, and i've not been playing all day/night which is what i wanted to be doing, this game just doesn't keep my attention that long, not to mention annoying bugs which keep you from communicating with your teammates, locking out your skills in hte middle of a mission ( not saying you can change them, you can't use the ones you've been using that you have equipped ) Try to make your character look different the character customization had a couple more options than the demo did ( to call it a beta would give it more credit than it deserves ) Then when you get in game and try to see how various clothing items look on your character you have to position carefully, it glitches goes dark, if a player or npc walks infront your vision is blocked and sometimes you even get kicked out of your ui, whether it be picking skills, looking at equipment, applying mods etc it just knocks you out... so not a week out and i'm almost htru the content there is no story, if you haven't purchased it then wait for a sale or till they make this game worth owning, if you can get a refund, this game is not worth 100. this game isn't worth 50$... its too short, sure they are releaseing the first dlc in the comming months, they have to, they released an unfinished, polished turd and are hoping we'll all swallow it with a smile on our face.. I can't get a refund because of the hours i've put in dealin with the issues of gui, and otherwise.... if you can refund it now !!  Its time to stop rewarding game publishers for ♥♥♥♥♥ products.. I was excited for Wildlands but after how crappy this has been wildlands has lost its interest, And if any games require uplay for use then that will be another factor contributing to me not buying it... Steam is all you need, in the 15 years or more i've used steam i've noticed a service interruption maybe twice for less than an hour... uplay i've been forced into using for the past couple of years and i've lost count how many times service has been interrupted or just how crappy the servers are when they are supposedly working as they should be.. I know its not my computer as i have no problems with other games / net services, have a great custom gaming rig, and a powerful internet connection, the problem is not on my end... currently i'd give divison a 5/10 and thats generous.... id love to give it a 2/10 but it really is a pretty looking turd... ugh.. what a waste of money..", "appid": "365590", "steamid": "profiles/76561198025708534", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 0, "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1457697600.0}

{"text": "Loving this so far. At Early Access, this game definitely exceeded my expectations. I've been playing it for hours on end. There's a lot to do.  The fact that it's early access and has so many features is extremely exciting, and one of my favorite things about this game are the AI decisions(ESPECIALLY other wolves, and your mate in particular, the AI responses are based on how you react and vice versa, they respond depending on what you do in regards to emotes and how you behave in the environment.) AND the fact that it seems like your mate adapts to how you hunt and behave as well! Either that, or maybe I was the one who adapted... :) Lol. Either way, hunting has become so much easier since I first started with my mate. And it is so fun too. I play on Challenging, and I really enjoy how careful I have to be with my health, because one second you've taken down prey, and the next you realize you are in enemy wolf territory and have a couple of hungry wolves from the territory you have to have enough health to fight and defend what's yours! Speaking of fights, I've gotten into so many already, and I've stolen so much enemy pack territory, haha, I love the fact that you can mark your turf and fight for good hunting locations. I am currently overlapping two wolf pack territories, Wapiti and Junction pack territory, and there's always action to be had around here. Because of all this territory defense and all these victories, my pack has over 350% Affinity now, and it seems like the higher the affinity the more specific needs/actions/behavior your mate will expect of you. Compared to when we first met, he was hyper and always play bowed, now he's stopped doing that for the most part, and now he's definitely starting to act like he recognizes my strength and is very submissive towards my wolf, now it definitely feels like my wolf's Alpha aura is finally coming through to him. I love how immersive this is. It actually feels like a real wolf couple. Can't wait for further development!!  I love the graphics and the design of the game. I'm iffy on the walk and trot animations however because they seem to be a little choppy, in my opinion they need to be worked on a bit more to be smoother if realism is the goal of this game. It just doesn't fit to have a wonky walking wolf in such a realistic environment. Makes it feel like the wolf doesnt belong. I'd love to have a free camera option for better screenshots! I've been having so much fun experimenting with different poses, but it sucks that when I take those screenshots, my wolf always seems to be the main focus, and it gets rid of some of that realistic screenshot immersion for me. It's probably planned down the road somewhere, but just in case it has not been considered, hopefully the developers read this and address that! I can't wait to take advantage of the beauty of this game with screenshots. Something else that would be great, would be having your own territory marker. Like how the other packs have colored hexagons filled into the map, I'd like to have my own colored turf instead of \"unclaimed\" turf when you mark yours around the perimeter. For now, it's just an aesthetic touch, and it isn't very important, but I'd love to have my pack's name showing up on the map and all the claimed territories rather than a lack of identification for the land I have eliminated of other pack presence, like I have been doing so far in place of actually \"Claiming\" any turf, but it's actually unclaiming land for the enemy pack. (It's a favor I'm doing them, trust me, they don't want lands full of mean, territorial wolves, so I claim the land so they don't have to fear me in their turf. ;) Ha! Get it? More turf for me, thank you kindly Wapiti and Junction pack. Now I have the best hunting grounds in the entire map. I explored the whole map and this is the best place for Elk and Mule Deer so far.)", "appid": "926990", "steamid": "profiles/76561198308409858", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "2", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": true, "tstamp_created": 1564747200.0}

{"text": "Начался мой путь в соц. республике Морровинд, и было это прекрасно. После небольшой коммандировки в Сирдииле и незапланированого посещения Обливиона, меня направили в горы республики Скурим, помогать бедняге Туллию с подвалением восстания бухих, небритых, и очень гордых   нордских националистов. Дальше - как в тумане: Хелген, операция по смене пола, чья-то казнь,     Алдуин, горы лута и просто горы... Интересный регион, это ваш Скурим. Тут   девятью забытые хутора оказываются областными центрами. Тут зверолюди имеют право носить обувь. Тут земное притяжение куда сильнее, чем в родном Морровинде или неродном Сиродииле. Тут Императора убивают не культисты, а  . Да и Император какой-то ненастоящий... Тут злые-презлые твари-драконы совершают одно из самых страшных действий в rpg - безсовестно убивают важных npc.  Еще тут какие-то хипстеры нарисовались, и втирают какую-то дичь про то, что какой-то тамлар... талмар... теперь командует парадом. Почему? А вот потому что. А кроме этого - практически всё изменилось со времён упразднения школы мистицизма.  Осталось лишь что-то неуловимое. {"text": "Ok. Lets start with the elephant in the room. First of all, this game WAS framerate locked at 30FPS on launch. LAME. It took the developers about 30 hours (after an uproar from PC gamers) to patch the game. Now the framerate is unlocked. Additionally, the patch appears to have polished the game in a few other ways as well. If you were holding off because of this, now is the time to buy, as it has been resolved. I'm frankly annoyed that the issue was there to begin with, but I'm also extremely impressed at how quickly it was patched. This game is raw, and gritty. I like that! They don't attempt to hide any racial tension, swear words, gore, or anything else that might offend anyone. This is a raw gangster story, and thats what the Mafia games have always been about. It is slightly strange to be taking down the Italian Mob that we worked so hard on building in the last 2 games, but the new characters are voiced well, interesting, and well written. I'm ok with this too! This game goes out on a limb and takes risks. They are portraying content that some may not like, and making a huge change on a beloved series. As a MASSIVE Mafia 2 fan, I'm actually ok with this. I would like to see Mafia 4 return to the Italian mob, as that bunch has always been a fun one to explore, but I'm ok with this detour. This game explores the other side of the Italian Mob. What happens when they run over the wrong people. Ect. If you like open world games, this is certainly worth a purchase. Especially when I see that we have been given some wonderful options like disabling aim assitance and field of view. {"text": "(Full review follows below) \t  is a game that delivers exactly what it is meant to.  It is a casual experience that is truly casual; unlike the myriad of indie games that appear “casual” only to reveal themselves to be frustrating due to poor design/mechanics.  If you are looking for something relaxing to play after a long day, you’ll find that here.  The only down side being that it isn’t a very long game; there are only 60 total levels. But it is very reasonably priced and there is good replay value. I grew up playing block-breaker games in the early 90s at the local pub. While my parents had their after-dinner drinks, I would pump quarters into the little touch-screen machine at the corner of the bar. So when I saw   for less loose change than I had in my pocket, I had to pick it up. And I’m glad I did.    is a very simple and enjoyable modern imagining of the block-breaker genre. It offers a nice blend of nostalgic charm and simple, relaxing gameplay. It is an excellent game to zone out to when you just need to unwind for a bit. But the best feature of   is how it remains pleasantly minimalist and simple while offering a nice array of unique and individualized takes on the long established genre. It is also worth noting that the soundtrack is highly enjoyable and works perfectly to encapsulate the feel of the game.  This soundscape helps create a very relaxing and “Zen” atmosphere that is easy to zone out to. If music is an important part of your relaxing game choices, you should be pleased with what you find here. Lastly, just be sure to note that   is a very short and minimal game. It won’t appeal to everyone; especially “hardcore” gamers.  But if you like having a go-to-list of simple, relaxing games for those days you’re too tired to play something mentally taxing, then you should consider this strongly as a candidate.", "appid": "371500", "steamid": "profiles/76561198057849814", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "80", "votes_funny": "1", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1469102400.0}

{"text": "Ubisoftun uzun sürede başarılı olduğu sayılı oyunlardan. Oyun competitive olarak çok başarılı,yani bence csgodan çok daha kaliteli bir oyun. Sistemi yetenler ve kenarda 20-30 tl parası olanlar için harika bir oyun.  Oyunda 3 tanr mod var: -terrorist hunt=çok oynamadığım için çok bilgim yok. Ama tek veye başka insanlarla botlara karşı savaşıyoruz vr bunun sonucunda galip gelirsek renown(oyun içi kazanılabilen para birimi) -casual=3 çeşit mod var bunun içerisinde;hostage,bomb ve secure area Hostage:1 saldırı 1 de defans grubu var. Saldırı grubu rehine(hostage)yi alıp tahliye noktadına götürmeye çalışıyor. Defans takımı da bunu önlemeye çalışıyor.  Bomb:yine 1 saldırı 1 defans timi var. Saldırı timi bombanın yerini saptayıp defuser(imha edici)yi kurmaya çalışıyor. Defuser kurulduktan sonra onu korumaları lazım çünkü defans takı defuseri çöüp roundu kazanabilir.  Secure area:yine 1 saldırı 1 defans timi var. Saldırı timi bir konteynerin olduğu odayı bulup orayı secure(kontrol altına alması gerekiyor) ama o odada defans takımından biri varsa secure olsuı duruyor ve o karakter odadan çıkmadığı veya ölmediği sürece secure işlemi duruyor CASUALDA 3 OLAN TAKIM KAZANIR -competitive=casualda olanların aynısı. {"text": "Геймплейно игра не особо потерпела изменения. Разве что добавлен микрофон в камеру и режим записи(причем очень интересно построен). Только в этот раз нам приходится бегать не по узким коридорам лечебницы, а по маленьким деревушкам с кучкой недоумков, которые хотят тебя убить. Если уж заговорили о самих локациях, то нельзя не упомянуть их разнообразие. От деревен из сгнивших досок до катакомб(Которые почему-то напомнили локации из RE4, да и сами враги).  За сюжет игру сложновато оценить. Подача сильно изменилось со времён первой части. Здесь же теперь надо обязательно читать записки, чтобы понять суть сюжета. Хотя даже с ними люди разделились на 2 лагеря, у каждого из которых своя теория по поводу концовки игры. Забыл отметить, что уровни на локации школы тоже привнесли некое разнообразие игры. Сначала ты думаешь, что на школьных локациях гораздо спокойнее и безопаснее, но вскоре ты понимаешь, насколько сильно ошибался. Очень рад, что главный герой стал комментировать какие-либо действия, которые просходят вокруг. Плюс ко всему, если  вы снимите какой-то фрагмент, то просмотрев его - главный герой обсудит его. Графика стала немного лучше, но разница с предыдущей части не слишком велика. Но на всё очень приятно смотреть, все эффекты выполнены на отличном уровне.  Игра ничем не хуже первого Outlast. P.S. Тот чудик, который гонится за вами в школе имеет необычную анимацию. Если присмотреться, то можно заметить, что  две его руки заняты мастурбацией. {"text": "The Hyperdimension Neptunia universe is an incredibly popular world of games, anime, merchandise, and much more. This addition to the impressive list of games that this world consists of is a major stride away from the usual JRPG anime games produced by the developers. Instead, this game is a bullet-heck with a side scrolling perspective and multiple popular Neptunia characters to play as. This also serves as the arguably most difficult game in the Neptunia series to complete, and is bound to take quite a few tries to progress through. Neptunia Shooter allows players to play as many of the famous characters which you meet whilst playing through any of the other Neptunia games. As you continue through the game, you defeat bosses (these aforementioned other characters) which allows you to play as that boss/character during your current playthrough. Each character has a different type of projectile and playstyle, all of which you must actively balance and use throughout the game in order to efficiently conquer Neptunia Shooter. To do this, you are granted the ability to switch between all of the characters you have beaten and unlocked during a particular run whenever you please, actively giving you the ability to change who you play as and how your character plays. This game strays away from the normal anime-styled graphics and models for a charming pixel art style. I find that this pixel art interpretation of the characters doesn't take away from the characters at all, and makes the game feel like a retro throwback with a bit of added charm. One of Neptunia Shooter's greatest weaknesses is the amount of time it takes to beat the game. Many players will see drastically varying play times according to how much trouble they have completing the game, but usually the game will last 1-2 hours. I do believe there is some replay-ability though, as you may seek to climb the leaderboards or use it as a fun game to watch your friends struggle through. There are also some achievements which can take quite a lot of effort to get, potentially adding some additional goals for players. Neptunia Shooter is a charming side scrolling bullet-heck game set within the Hyperdimension Neptunia universe. Being able to play as the beloved characters from the series adds an additional level of fan service to anyone who may be interested in playing the game. Otherwise, the game is held back by its lack of content or inherent replay-ability. Overall this is an excellent game for any fans of the series, but for others outside of the fanbase this may be more of a hit or miss experience.", "appid": "1037590", "steamid": "profiles/76561198105806147", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 0, "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1594123200.0}

{"text": "Good game, but a little bit hard to find matches. Add me as afriend if you want to play.", "appid": "394230", "steamid": "profiles/76561198868296007", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "12", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1561896000.0}
{"text": "Visage可以说是所有PT-like恐怖游戏的集大成之作，也是第一人称心理恐怖游戏的一个巅峰。但是游戏解谜难度较高，不看攻略难以通关，对快餐玩家非常劝退。综合来看，说Visage是个准神作是没问题的。不出意外的话这游戏就是我心目中的2020年年度恐怖游戏了。 先说游戏的玩法，是很常见的带追逐战和解谜的探索类步行模拟，游戏难度主要体现在解谜的难度和游戏对自身机制的解释不清上： 游戏的解谜主要就是找某个道具，用在某个地方上。由于整个游戏的地图比较大，而且隐藏区域很多，玩家一定要把每个区域都摸得很熟才可以找到解谜的方法，而玩家光是做到不迷路就很难得了（游戏解谜给我的感觉就是第一人称的恐怖之歌，但是恐怖之歌是有地图的，而这个游戏是没有地图的，直接导致本游戏的解谜难度比恐怖之歌还高出一档）。 而游戏机制解释不清，我指的主要就是鬼出现的机制，这也是最容易让玩家懵逼的地方——可能很多人玩着玩着就会产生一个疑惑：“这鬼我真的躲得掉吗？”。游戏中的鬼会在两种情况下出现，第一种就是剧情脚本叫出来的鬼，第二种就是玩家SAN值过低的时候刷出来的鬼。前者一定是有方法可以躲开的，只不过有些方法需要钻研一下才知道。而最恶心的是后者，虽然理论上只要和鬼拉开一段距离就可以躲开，而鬼跑的又很慢不难躲，但是实际上因为鬼是随机刷出来的，所以如果刷在地形不好的地方还真不一定有地方可以跑。而SAN值越低，鬼出现的概率越大，在SAN值见底时几乎是必定会刷出来的，所以这里就存在一个死档的风险——如果玩家在SAN值很低时触发了游戏的自动保存，那可能就会陷入被鬼杀死-->读档-->被鬼杀死-->读档的死循环。因此为了避免这种情况的出现，建议游戏过程中身上一定常备一瓶药，SAN值低时如果附近没有光源可以回SAN的话要果断嗑，最好不要等到SAN值见底再嗑（SAN值越低灵异事件发生的频率越高，碰到灵异事件会降低SAN值形成恶性循环，所以要嗑就趁早嗑。不过光源可以回复SAN值，所以有光源时没有嗑药的必要，除非SAN值见底或者鬼刷脸上了）。另外就是在安全的时候手动存个档，这样就算自动存档死了还可以读手动档。 游戏分为3+1个章节，每个章节的玩法是有一定差别的，这是一个很有意思的地方： Lucy篇：最恐怖的一章，解谜相对较弱，而怪的出现频率比较高。本章非常黑，主要依靠闪光灯照明，同时部分谜题和部分jumpscare都是围绕着闪光灯来安排的。 Dolores篇：非常重解谜，地图大而复杂，路痴噩梦，反之怪没有太大存在感。 Rakan篇：从难度角度来说是最简答的一章，追逐战比较多，但并不难。 三章全部通关后在房子里找7个录像带，每个录像带对应一个谜题，解出7个谜题后游戏通关，这就是所谓的第四章。录像带会显示出若干个场景，其中至少一个场景在房子内，玩家需要凭借自己对房子的了解程度找出这个场景在房子的何处。由于房子很大所以这个解谜并不容易。 与困难的解谜相对的，就是游戏简单的动作场景，游戏潜行的占比很低，主要的动作戏都是追逐，前面也说过鬼跑得慢，把鬼甩开一段距离鬼就会消失，所以追逐并不难。 对于没有被解谜玩法劝退的玩家来说，他们就可以体会到这个游戏真正的魅力了——强大的恐怖氛围和大量的jumpscare，使得就恐怖程度而言在同类游戏里鲜有能出其右者。正如开头所说，Visage是一个集大成之作：游戏总体的场景设置（尤其是Lucy篇）有明显借鉴/致敬PT的痕迹，此外还有房门上的锁链和在幻境中穿梭（寂静岭4），超现实的回廊（层层恐惧），Rakan篇与精神病人在医院中的追逐战（逃生）等等。 再说剧情，剧情其实挺弱的。套路类似咒怨，住进凶宅的所有人一定会死。主角作为凶宅最新的住客，在游戏一开头就发疯崩了自己全家。（特别强调一下这个游戏的成人内容描述是认真的。身为一个阅片无数的人，这个开头都能令我感到不适，特别是崩小女孩的时候。）在游戏过程中主角可以了解到另外三位住客的命运（Lucy是最惨的了，Lucy那奇葩的死法再次引起不适）。叙事都是碎片化的，靠玩家自己拼凑。要说唯一可圈可点之处就是游戏中没有任何纸条需要读了。 游戏的汉化没有什么大问题。唯一要注意的是游戏中有些墙上的纸条会藏有线索，而这些纸条不但没有字幕还都是用英文写的，还有Dolores篇有一个藏有谜题线索的纸条在汉化后把线索丢失了。因此一些基础的英语水平还是必要的。 然后说BUG，目前版本基本上没有大BUG了，我只提醒两点：在玩前三章的时候不要去做录像带的解谜，不然谁知道会发生啥莫名其妙的BUG。还有就是注意定期手动存档，就算自动存档频率比较高，也不应该对其过度依赖（这个道理估计大家都懂）。 在最后我要说下这个游戏除了难度之外另一个被人诟病的地方——操控。这游戏是VR原生游戏，所以操控方式完全是为VR量身打造的，但是如果在非VR模式下玩，这个操控就非常傻逼了。无论扔东西还是拿东西都极其麻烦，物品还分左右手，使用物品需要长按等等。", "appid": "594330", "steamid": "profiles/76561198088946146", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "6", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1605441600.0}

{"text": "Presencie a Primeira Guerra Mundial de duas perspectivas diferentes. • A  : A história tem dois seguimentos, que seguem o ponto de vista do jovem fotógrafo Canadense Harry Lambert, e o engenheiro Alemão Kurt Waldner. A história de Harry, é contada através das lembranças dele, mostrando como foi ''recrutado'' para fotografar a guerra. Já a história de Kurt, é contada através das cartas que ele mandava para sua esposa, aonde relatava os acontecimentos da guerra, enquanto ele buscava pelo seu filho desaparecido. E é essas duas visões que te fazem sentir a profundidade da inocência, a determinação e a humanidade que tinham os soldados da Primeira Guerra. • Em aspectos técnicos, a história é muito bem roteirizada e sem deixar pontas soltas. Todos os rumos que a história toma, tem um porque e um motivo claro. Além disso, você pode influenciar esses acontecimentos, já que o jogo te permite fazer escolhas. Nem sempre as escolhas vão ter uma consequência marcante na história, mas, com o passar do tempo, vai ficando mais visível as suas ações, vide que o jogo possuí 6 finais. • A   e  : A jogabilidade é simples. Tratando de um jogo linear e focado na narrativa, ficou mais um ''walking simulator'' sem muita ação(o que pode ou não ser ruim). Apresenta alguns mini puzzles que facilmente podem ser resolvidos e também não tem muito impacto na história. • Os comandos no teclado podem ser um pouco confusos, mas no controle são excelentes. • Os  : É aqui que o jogo tem o seu diferencial. A estética é bem única, feito com um tom artístico. Quase como uma ''pintura jogável''. • A  : Imersiva e bem encaixada nos momentos e cenários do jogo. • Permite jogar com um gatinho e um pombo.  Para quem curte boa narrativa em contexto histórico, é um ótimo jogo. {"text": "Bully: Scholarship Edition (2008) Rockstar New England Bully - игра, которую запросто можно пропустить, но делать это не рекомендуется по нескольким причинам. Невероятно сильный саундтрек, сумасшедшее разнообразие геймплея и крайне высокий показатель качества продукции Rockstar Games.  События игры происходят на территории небольшого городка Буллворд, именем которого и названа школа, в которой учится главный герой игры Джимми.  Действие делится на 3 главные составные части - миссии, обучение в школе и побочные задания, обусловленные песочным геймплеем. Собери, найди, исследуй. В Bully нет больших машин, огромных территорий и выстрелов из дробовика, чего все ждут от создателей GTA. Но здесь есть возможность выйти из школы, выехать на скейте в город, заработать деньги раскидывая почту, помочь людям на улице, забежать в магазин за новой одеждой, выиграть кубок в гонках на велосипеде, посмотреть на закат солнца, а по пути в общежитие навешать агрессивным ученикам, которые практикуют избиение младших. Зайти в свою комнату, где в процессе игры собираются трофеи и лечь спать, чтобы завтра встать и пойти на новый урок, а после него исследовать город, наблюдать за интересным сюжетом и запоминающимися персонажами. Здесь есть главное - атмосфера, окунаясь в которую можно вернуть немного того, что навсегда утеряно - школьные, свободные годы. {"text": "Долгое время в свободном доступе была лишь базовая информация о концепте, сеттинге и главных персонажах. Постепенно появлялись скриншоты, трейлеры, которые уже могли вызывать и беспокойства о проекте, и даже некое дежавю - уж слишком много времени я провел в играх серии  , чтобы всадник на фоне деревушки не вызывал у меня ассоциаций. В истории отечественной игровой индустрии, к сожалению, имеется огромное количество примеров игр, убитых собственными амбициями. Я искренне надеюсь, что этот проект не пополнит этот список.       Релиз альфа версии свалился на меня как снег на голову, как он оформлен в стиме это конечно вопрос спорный, но сам сюрприз вышел очень приятным. При запуске игрока встречает внушительное текстовое описание, что именно разработчики не рекомендуют делать, дабы не сломать игру. Плюсом к этому описано, какие изменения будут к финальной версии. Поэтому затрагивать технические аспекты, графику, делать акценты на анимации или боевой системе я не буду. Авторы как могут обыгрывают текущие несовершенства игры, например пустоту на локациях, и хотят познакомить всех с миром, персонажами и завязкой сюжета, с чем альфа версия справляется прекрасно.          или   погружает игрока в альтернативную Российскую Империю на заре XIX века, а играть предстоит за новобранца Имперской тайной разведки. В прологе доступно его первое задание, а именно разобраться что происходит в одной отдаленной от Столицы деревушке.   довольно интересный и интригующий, хорошая подача через грамотно прописанные диалоги. Порой авторы пытаются в юмор, хотят высмеять определенные клише, но выходит это не всегда удачно. Несколько мудрых изречений от компаньонов меня даже удивили. Проработанные характеры персонажей, не скажу что каждый пестрит харизмой, но к основным действующим лицам претензий нет. Прекрасно передан контраст между образованными офицерами и темными крестьянами, которые по своему трактуют происходящие вокруг события. Если первые руководствуются здравым смыслом и ищут логику, то вторые уверены в распоясавшейся нечистой силе. Все приключение длится пару часов, за которые все вопросы получают ответы, а судьбы некоторых персонажей целиком в руках игрока.       Конечно не призываю всех и каждого поддерживать разработчиков на кикстартере, однако как я вижу, игра получает гораздо меньше внимания, чем заслуживает. You die when there is only 25% of your total bot left. (your hud displays your health without this, simple enough. this is only here for balance) You may only have 5 diffrent weapons on your robot at once, you may only select one at a time in combat. (NOTE THEIR ARE DIFFRENT LEVELS OF WEAPONRY FOR EACH WEAPON, A CERTAIN LEVEL COUNTS AS A WEAPON SLOT. IN REALITY THIS IS DEPRESSING)  Modes Robocraft has an multiple gamemodes to play.  Team DeathMatch (TDM) is a 5v5 where both teams must get points by destroying eachother, when you get to a certain threshold of kills (points) you win. The rewards here are ehhh bad? yep bad. AI TDM. (Theres also protontivity, meaning you do more damage to towers and the base the longer the game goes on and the more towers you have, ALSO capturing a tower revives everyone waiting for their long respawn instantly) The rewards here are the best of all modes and yet terrible League Battle Arena. Ditto to above, except winning or losing increases or decreases league ranking (league ranking is a non existent version of competitive ranking, there is Bronze Silver Gold Platinum and Protonuim, your rank does not ever deviate and once you get to the highest ranking you never have to play this again, the only thing league rank gets you is a badge cosmetic for your bot that you cant otherwise get, rank is not shown anywhere except this cosmetic, meaning rank means nothing at all ever.)  Building. Here you build your robot out of blocks of which are divided into Blocks, Movement, Hardware, (guns) misc, (radar equipment and modules, RADAR EQUIPMENT DOES NOTHING AT ALL DO NOT USE IT) and cosmetics. this is easily the most enjoyable part of the game which in itself has become stale and no longer fun. Most of the time, I just didn't want to deal with the game anymore and just found a rock to stand on where the AI seems to bug out and most of the dinosaurs just stare at you as if you're Chris Pratt holding a mouse in front of a pit of velociraptors. Of the 128ish hours I have on this game, a portion was spent looking at the server browser for Redik 600 servers and a giant portion of it was spent sitting on a rock next to the harvester in third person using it's auto-lock on feature to become a turret and mow down ambushing dinos while reviving the harvester whenever it decides to go down. Most of the time, my left hand wasn't even on the keyboard while playing. A lot of what this game is about is stretching the truth. It's like looking at a car ad and the features listed were stuff you'd expect from it like \"four wheels, mirrors, doors, engine.\" and then stretches it by saying \"is running, sold as is.\" which leaves you wondering if there was something sketchy about it. There is an open world in terms of player hubs, but nothing to really do in these hubs except enter servers, and when you're in game, the \"open world\" is pretty limited to an area that you're allowed to stay in or else you die in 10 seconds. There is a increasing difficulty, as in the dinos don't scale in stats as waves increase, the only increase in difficulty is there will be a few more dinos spawning in the wave and a few more big ones will have a slightly bigger chance of spawning. There are unique augments, resources, and crafting in the game, but most of the time, you'll just be trying to craft that legendary augment for that class you're using but instead get an augment for another class. The game also says there are exclusive dinos that spawn on certain maps but I have never actually seen that happen once as every dino spawns at least once every map. A lot of the features that sound interesting in this game's about section is content that isn't even in the game yet. But I'm not rating the game based on future content, I'm rating it based on current content, which is very little unless you like to be social, but I didn't buy it for a social aspect, I bought it for what it was advertised as, a man vs. dino shooter. Personally, it's not a good game, it's not a bad game either. If you want to go around and shoot dinosaurs, just get Orion Prelude. It's just the same, but with more features. {"text": "Trash", "appid": "578080", "steamid": "profiles/76561198138934491", "voted_up": false, "votes_up": "1", "votes_funny": "1", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1562241600.0}
{"text": "Das Grundprinzip von Evolve ist sehr leicht erklärt: Die vier Jäger versuchen das Monster zur Strecke zu bringen bevor es sich zur 3. Phase entwickeln kann (daher der Name „Evolve“). Zu Beginn verteilt das Monster drei Fähigkeitspunkte auf verschiedene Skills. Damit das Monster sich entwickeln kann muss es verschiedene Tiere jagen und diese verspeisen. Dadurch füllt sich sowohl das Schild (ich würde „Speckschicht\" sagen :D), als auch die Entwicklungsanzeige auf.  Ist diese Anzeige einmal voll, kann die Entwicklung initiiert werden. Dadurch wird die Lebensanzeige erhöht und es stehen drei weitere Fähigkeitspunkte zur Verfügung. Je weiter sich das Monster entwickelt, desto schwieriger wird es für die Jäger dieses zu eliminieren. Hat das Monster die dritte und somit letzte Phase erreicht, so hat es die Möglichkeit ein Stromrelais zu zerstören, was den Sieg der Runde bedeutet. Das Balancing ist dabei sehr gut gelungen: Beide Seiten sind gleich stark und das 4v1-Konzept geht sehr gut auf, vorrausgesetzt das Jäger Team arbeitet zusammen und nutzt die verschiedenen Klassenfähigkeiten aus. Nur das dritte Monster. Der „Geist“ ist meiner Meinung nach etwas zu stark geraten. Die Maps sind sich relativ ähnlich und haben kaum Wiedererkunnungswert: Meist handelt es sich um eine grün-braune Matsche. Die Idee das Wetter bei den Maps zu variieren ist durchaus nett und sorgt für ein wenig Abwechlung: In der einen Runde schneit es auf der Map, in einer anderen regnets dann auch mal! Des weiteren beeinflusst die Flora und Fauna das Gameplay: So stellen die verschiedenen Tierarten,  die sich in der Wildnis tummeln, sowohl für Monster, als auch für die Jäger eine Gefahr dar: Wenn man nicht aufpasst , wo genau man hintritt, passiert es ganz schnell, dass man z.B. von einer fleischfressenden Pflanze gefangen wird, oder in einen ätzenden Sumpf latscht.  Leider gibt es nur drei verschiedene Monster zur Auswahl und die größte Zeit wird man wohl den Standard „Jagd“-Modus spielen. Das Spiel ist sehr repetitiv: Generell wird man häufig zwei arten von Matches spielen:  Die Technik von Evolve ist durchaus solide: Die „Cry Engine 3“ sorgt für eine stimmige Optik: Die Texturen sind größtenteils sehr hübsch (mit Ausnahme einiger Bodentexturen) und vor allem die Partikeleffekte und die Beleuchtung sind sehr gut gelungen. Auch der Sound, welcher für das „Katz' und Maus-Prinzip“ essentiell ist, wurde hervorragend umgesetzt: Man weiß genau, welche Geräusche von wo kommen und auch an Umgebungsgeräuschen finde ich nichts zu meckern. Nur der Soundtrack ist relativ belangenlos und könnte etwas abwechlungsreicher sein und sich dem Geschehen etwas mehr anpassen. Das Grundkonzept ist definitiv sehr gut, nur haben sich die Entwickler wenig Mühe gegeben dem Spiel etwas Abwechslung einzuhauchen, sodass man definitive von einem repetitiven Spielerlebnis reden kann. Der mangelnde Umfang lassen „Evolve“ eher wie ein (sehr gut aussehendes) Free-to- Play-Spiel aussehen.  50 Euro für das Spiel zu verlangen ist definitiv eine Frechheit von 2K: Anstatt alle Ressourcen in das Hauptspiel zu investieren, hat man sich eher auf die Einbindung eines belangenlosen Ingame-Shop mit sündhaft teuren Preisen für Skins und investiert.  Zudem wird auch noch ein Seasonpass verkauft (welcher noch nicht einmal alle DLC-Inhalte umfasst) angeboten. Das wäre ja alles gar kein Problem, wenn wenigstens das Hauptspiel einen Umfang hätte, den man von einem 50 (!) Euro AAA-Titel erwarten würde.  Ich empfehle das Spiel höchstens in einem Steam Sale zu einem stark reduzierten Preis zu kaufen, denn man kann sicherlich ein paar Stunden richtig Spaß mit dem Spiel haben! Für die verlangten 50 Euro im Steam Store, ist das Spiel somit keine Kaufempfehlung, auch wenn „Evolve“ im Grunde kein schlechtes Spiel ist! Die Entwickler haben versprochen kostenlose Maps später nachzuliefern. Ich werde mein Review natürlich überarbeiten, sollten diese Inhalte für mehr Abwechslung sorgen und den mangelnden Umfang etwas aufzustocken.", "appid": "273350", "steamid": "profiles/76561198044407788", "voted_up": false, "votes_up": "640", "votes_funny": "42", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1424692800.0}

{"text": "i really want to like this game but after some of the experiences i had with it, i decided not to, the game is physics based and thats really cool, however said physics engine is far from enjoyable, the game uses a reverse kinematics skeleton to see where your limbs and body are supposed to be, with that said, alot of the movements that i was able to do in real life are very restricted in game, either i cant aim properly or hit things because of the characters paralysed wrist that makes your arm look weak holding a crowbar, did i mention that your wrist wobbles and bends around when you hack enemies. On to the firearm combat, its very moderate, sure the physics is a fresh aspect, but you have to reload with another mag, i meant you hold a mag next to your gun for the empty mag to fall out on to your fresh mag clipping the physics and thats 3 more seconds wasted in intense combat with holograms balls. Also dont forget the mag holder is right next to your left armpit holster, that means when your rifle runs dry, your emergency secondary pistol would instead be a fresh mag * might appeal to some*. Forget about vaulting things, because your legs are crippled as well, making scaling over objects slower than my grandma does it. Oh and my hatchet clips through the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ floor once in a while. Now on to the story aspect, it has no clear storyline, why? because the in game world called MythOS is a work in progress, the developers jammed random textures and objects in to the game, its a literal Gmod server / halflife / portal wannabe. It feels like the dev decided to used prototype object and ai to build the world while adding more detailed objects as their skills in CAD improves.   after my rant, its still a fun experimental game, but i cant take neither the story nor the characters nor the physics seriously, because its just, unsatisfactory and frustrating", "appid": "823500", "steamid": "profiles/76561198144719896", "voted_up": false, "votes_up": 0, "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1591272000.0}
